required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BO and DO in Women With Cystocele Before and After Cystocele Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Bladder Oversensitivity and Detrusor Overactivity in Women With Cystocele and the Changes of Storage Function After Cystocele Repair

brief_summary.textblock: The changes of lower urinary tract function after cystocele repair are important for perioperative consultation and management. Thus, the aim of this retrospective study was to evaluate the prevalence of bladder oversensitivity and detrusor overactivity in women with ≥ stage II cystocele and the changes of storage function after cystocele repair.

detailed_description.textblock:
Bladder oversensitivity and detrusor overactivity are two important diagnosis of urodynamic study regarding storage function of bladder. Between November 2010 and October 2020, all women with ≥ stage II cystocele who visited the urogynecological department of a medical center for cystocele repair were reviewed. Those women who had complete data of preoperative and postoperative 3-month follow-up urodynamic data were excluded from this study. Bladder oversensitivity was diagnosed if the volume of strong desire was less than 300mL. Detrusor overactivity was defined as the occurrence of involuntary detrusor contractions during filling cytometry.
STATA software was used for statistical analysis. Chi2 test, univariate and multivariable logistic regression tests were used for statistical analysis as appropriate. A p < 0.05 was considered as statistically significant.

primary_outcome.description: the volume of strong desire was less than 300mL
the occurrence of involuntary detrusor contractions during filling cytometry

arm_group.description: women with ≥ stage II cystocele who visited the urogynecological department of a medical center for cystocele repair

intervention.description: Repair of endopelvic fascia and anterior colporrhaphy

study_pop.textblock: women with ≥ stage II cystocele who visited the urogynecological department of a medical center for cystocele repair

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women with ≥ stage II cystocele
- Received cystocele repair
- Complete urodynamic study before and after surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Recurrent cystocele after repairment
- Incomplete data
- Chronic infection
